wp:tag.wp:tag_name: New York Fashion Short Film Festival

item.title: Now We Run Shaolin Too
item.dc:creator: rubinfinite
item.content:encoded: New Ghostface track "Harbor Masters" from the forthcoming album Wu-Tang Chamber Music featuring AZ and Inspectah Deck. The album brings together Wu MCs and other '90s rap legends over tracks played by Brooklyn soul group the Revelations. Bridge Runner Noah Rubin co-produced and mixed the record so you know it's fire! Download it here. Some press on the track from around the internets: The Fader Nah Right

item.title: FAST WOMEN IN HIGH HEELS...FOR A CAUSE
item.dc:creator: rubinfinite
item.content:encoded: Upstate was the place to be last week, apparently. On June 24th, Buffalo shoe store, Shoefly hosted their "Stiletto Run" to benefit the Ovarian Cancer National Alliance. The .5 K race boasted over 150 runners, both men and women. Much respect to all who participated—especially the dudes in heels! In terms of a future joint venture though? As much as I'd like to see it, stilettos over the Brooklyn Bridge prolly wouldn't be a good look... More: NYT The Moment Buffalo Local News

item.title: WU TANG CHAMBER MUSIC IN STORES TODAY!
item.dc:creator: rubinfinite
item.content:encoded:
Question: What happens when you bring together Ghostface Killah, Raekwon, RZA, Inspectah Deck and U-God then add Kool G Rap, Cormega, AZ, Sean Price, Masta Ace, and M.O.P., mix them all together and throw them on top of live instrumentals produced, edited, and mixed by Bridge Runner Noah Rubin to sound like it came straight from a Shaolin Swamp?

Answer: Wu Tang Chamber Music

The album comes out today and is already #2 on the iTunes hip hop chart, so get wise, open your third eye, and buy it today!

item.title: NEW HISTORICS ALBUM OUT NOW!
item.dc:creator: rubinfinite
item.content:encoded: Featuring Maroon 5 bassist Mickey Madden, VietNam guitarist Josh Grubb, Ink & Dagger/ Amazing Baby's Don Devore on guitar/vocals, keyboard player Dale Jiminez from Philly's Need New Body, and drummer Ryan Rapsys from Chicago's Euphone and Sea and Cake, Historics are a supergroup to say the least. Their debut record, "Strategies for Apprehension" was just released and is in stores and online now. Bridgerunner Noah Rubin worked on the record, which evokes everything from Krautrock, to jangly '60s pop, to psychedelic rap, thanks to a guest appearance by the legenary Kool Keith. To top it off, the record sports amazing cover art designed by Matt Damhave. Throw it in your iPod ASAP—its guaranteed to make your next run a better one! While you're downloading it from iTunes check out the video for the song "Taverns" below:

item.title: Bridgerunners: 4th NYC Half Marathon In A Row!
item.dc:creator: rubinfinite
item.content:encoded:
New York City is the place we call home. Even though our people over at Nike fell back this year on the NYC Half Marathon, that didn't stop a thick crew of Bridgerunners from taking to the course early and repping the event yet again. [caption id="attachment_1482" align="aligncenter" width="500" caption="TGIF (Thank G-d I'm Finished)"][/caption] Crazy heat, registration obstacles, and severe sleep deprivation meant nothing, cause once the gun blasted there was no stopping us from getting to the finish line. [caption id="attachment_1483" align="aligncenter" width="500" caption="4 Years Straight, Never Posing"][/caption] As usual, we had a few Half Marathon OGs (this is the 4th NYC Half Marathon for some of us!) and some Half Marathon virgins as well (nothing better than the first time!). [caption id="attachment_1490" align="aligncenter" width="500" caption="Heavy Medals (2006, 2007, 2008, 2009)"][/caption]

Regardless of each Bridgerunners' relative veteran status, everyone finished in serious style. If you missed out, don't sweat, cause we'll be there next year, and you should be too!

item.title: New York Fashion Shorts
item.dc:creator: rubinfinite
item.category: New York Fashion Short Film Festival
New York Fashion Short Film Festival
item.content:encoded:
Friday, Sept. 11th @ 11PM Tribeca Grand Hotel

Short film called "Ketchup" of performance/installation by Martynka Wawrzyniak and shot by Bridgerunner Noah Rubin is gonna be featured in "New York Fashion Shorts" film festival this Friday! Please RSVP and come through if you are around. Check out the video below and get ready to see it on the big screen! Ketchup from Noah Rubin on Vimeo. NEW YORK FASHION SHORTS New York Fashion Shorts will be showcasing 14 of the best fashion related short videos and films from across the world. The event will debut on September 11th , 2009 at 11pm during New York Fashion Week. The late night screening is being hosted by the Tribeca Grand Hotel, New York, and an after party is to follow with music by the Misshapes. Presented by designer Bruno Grizzo, and curated by the artist Konstantinos Menelaou, the screening is dedicated to promoting a medium, which has become an invaluable source of inspiration, originality and vision. The brilliantly received program from directors worldwide, represents a few of the many talented artists who are working in video form. It is a natural development of the creative means the internet brings about, and it makes perfect sense to explore it not only for commercial use but also for its immense aesthetic possibilities. A special thank you to the directors: ALEX GIOMO  *_I AM THAT I AM_* BIJOUX ALTAMIRANO  *_CRAZY_* MONICA ELKELV-DARREN KARL SMITH  *_I_* JASON LAST *_YOU MAKE ME FEEL_* JORDAN MATTOS *_SWF_* KATHRYN FERGUSON *_TDLM_* KONSTANTINOS MENELAOU & MARLON RUEBERG *_HOMECOMING_* INDIRA CESARINE *_KALEIDOSCOPIC_* WILLEM JASPERT & STEPHAN LANGMANIS *_HIDE N SEEK_* PANAGIOTIS DELILABROS *_FAME FAME FATAL FAME_* MARTYNKA WAWRZYNIAK/NOAH RUBIN *_KETCHUP_* ROMY+MAXIM NORTHOVER *_MY EXPENSIVE BABY_* RONNIT HASSON *_TRIPLETS_* NIGEL HOSANG *_CHADORALPHRUCCI CALM EDIT_* New York Fashion Shorts September 11th , 2009 11PM Tribeca Grand Hotel 2 Avenue of the Americas (6th Ave) New York, NY 10013 Please RSVP by Friday noon at studio@brunogrizzo.com *Special Thanks to Laura Brown and Tommy Saleh for making this possible.

item.title: Hamptons Marathon/Half-Marathon 2009
item.dc:creator: rubinfinite
item.content:encoded: Bridgerunners ran thick at this year's Hamptons Marathon/Half-Marathon with over a dozen finishers in our crew. The sun shone down and the ocean breeze blew, making for one of the nicest running days of the year. Big ups to all the first timers who ran hard! Though we're used to the early morning venture, top notch accommodations in Quogue (Thanks Austin!) meant a few hours extra sleep for all involved. After the run we headed to the beach to cool down quick, then stocked up for an intense post-run feast! Our 13 course dinner set the bar high, so we couldn't slack when it came to breakfast. Who knew there were so many Bridgerunners with skills on the hills and in the kitchen?
